title: How to Leave Feedback on eBay on PC or Mac

steps.headline: Go to https://www.ebay.com in your web browser.
steps.description: Now that your eBay transaction is complete, you have the opportunity to leave feedback for the other party in the sale. You have up to 60 days to leave feedback after completing your transaction.

steps.headline: Click My eBay.
steps.description: It’s near the top-right corner of the screen. If prompted to sign in, enter your eBay username and password, then click Sign in.

steps.headline: Click the Account tab.
steps.description: It’s near the top-left corner of the screen, right below “My eBay: Summary.”

steps.headline: Click the item for which you’d like to leave feedback.
steps.description: Items eligible for feedback appear under the “Items Awaiting Feedback” heading.

steps.headline: Rate your transaction.
steps.description: Leaving positive feedback helps eBay sellers build their reputations. If the transaction went smoothly, select Positive. If there were problems with the transaction that were resolved, but you’re still unhappy, select Neutral. If something went wrong and the other party did not sufficiently correct the issue in accordance with their policy, select Negative.

steps.headline: Type a comment.
steps.description:
The comment should summarize the reason you selected the above rating. For example, if you received the item as described within the standard delivery time, you may want to say, “Item as described. Fast shipping.”
If you sold an item but the buyer never paid, you may say something like, “Buyer never paid.”
You may also be prompted to leave a star rating for other aspects of the transaction, such as shipping timeliness or accuracy of the description.

steps.headline: Click Leave Feedback.
steps.description: It’s at the bottom of the ratings area. Your feedback will now appear on the buyer or seller’s page.

text:
Go to https://www.ebay.com in your web browser. Now that your eBay transaction is complete, you have the opportunity to leave feedback for the other party in the sale. You have up to 60 days to leave feedback after completing your transaction. Click My eBay. It’s near the top-right corner of the screen. If prompted to sign in, enter your eBay username and password, then click Sign in. Click the Account tab. It’s near the top-left corner of the screen, right below “My eBay: Summary.” Click Feedback. It’s in the left sidebar. Click the item for which you’d like to leave feedback. Items eligible for feedback appear under the “Items Awaiting Feedback” heading. Click Leave Feedback. It’s in the “Actions” column. Rate your transaction. Leaving positive feedback helps eBay sellers build their reputations. If the transaction went smoothly, select Positive. If there were problems with the transaction that were resolved, but you’re still unhappy, select Neutral. If something went wrong and the other party did not sufficiently correct the issue in accordance with their policy, select Negative. Type a comment. The comment should summarize the reason you selected the above rating. For example, if you received the item as described within the standard delivery time, you may want to say, “Item as described. Fast shipping.”
If you sold an item but the buyer never paid, you may say something like, “Buyer never paid.”
You may also be prompted to leave a star rating for other aspects of the transaction, such as shipping timeliness or accuracy of the description. Click Leave Feedback. It’s at the bottom of the ratings area. Your feedback will now appear on the buyer or seller’s page.
